intro: Eleutherococcus spinosus var. nikaianus, commonly known as the Nikianus eleuthero, is a deciduous shrub native to the Far East of Russia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers in the spring, followed by red berries that are an important food source for birds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
